It is idiomatic to have `XYZTest` be a test of of the class `XYZ`. One way to maintain this while splitting tests up is to use the JUnit `Suite` test runner. We have a few examples in our codebase. FWIW I think we should also do this with the `SplittableDoFnTest` and to break up various test classes. The sub-suites do not need to be suffixed with `Test`.
(note also that Beam differs from Google in that only a committer can issue a binding LGTM, so be sure to loop one in after initial review)

LGTM

@amitsela This PR fixes custom windows merginig in spark runner. The related `ValidatesRunner` custom window merging test is added in another PR (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3286) because it is related to another ticket. The https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3286 PR needs to be merged before the current one.

@aljoscha @amitsela Please note that this PR is to be merged before https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/3517 because it adds the test that is used in  https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/3517
https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/3517 fixes custom window merging in Spark Runner

LGTM and I'll wait for tests to pass.

@davorbonaci @jasonkuster I have now revised this again. To regain historical perspective:

Version 1: Two profiles (streaming/batch), two Jenkins jobs with different pipeline options to set `--streaming=true`. It was requested that there be a single profile with two executions.

Version 2: One profile, one Jenkins job, hence one set of pipeline options, two executions and a Java system property to force streaming mode since the pipeline options had to be the same. It took too long. Even bumping the timeout would just mean waiting many hours.

Version 3 (current): One profile, two executions, each has the ability to be skipped, two Jenkins jobs that each select an execution.

I left it with one set of test pipeline options and the Java system property. We could probably go back to separate pipeline options and clean it up. LMK what you think.
